ai-patthana15.22:0.2_0: The Order of the Dhamma: allows unintelligent in the Khadehaka, and constantly preciously:
ai-patthana15.22:0.3_0: Transmigration for those who attack themselves,
ai-patthana15.22:1.1_0: Not for the sake of fun, or for the sake of non-offense, nor for the sake of repulsion, only for the sake of repulsion, not for the sake of defilement, or for the sake of the (of the teaching);
ai-patthana15.22:1.1_1: Not for the sake of its have cause, and for the sake of non-violence, nor for the sake of repulsion, not for the sake of defilement, nor for the sake of any repulsion, but not for the sake of (of the teaching); and for the sake of the propagation of the teaching is a condition for the sake of the path, and for the sake of the teaching.
ai-patthana15.22:1.1_2: There are three objects for the sake of preventing the object, for the sake of non-existence, there is none,
ai-patthana15.22:2.1_0: You shouldn’t give rise to repulsion because of not grasping.
ai-patthana15.22:3.1_0: for the sake of insisting on teaching, not for the sake of repulsion.
ai-patthana15.22:3.1_1: You don’t give rise to repulsion for the sake of not grasping.
ai-patthana15.22:3.1_2: It’s because of not giving up resentment for someone without impingement, not for the sake of repulsion, for the sake of no repulsion.
ai-patthana15.22:3.1_3: ... ‘They are the three kinds of known ...’ ...
ai-patthana15.22:3.1_4: There are three more mendicants who have no regrets.
